column1: Before 1991 Trinidad was divided into eight counties.
Tobago is a ward of Trinidad and Tobago and is governed locally by the Tobago House of Assembly.

column2: Tobago was divided into seven parishes (Saint Andrew
column7: Saint Patrick and Saint Paul). In 1768 each parish of Tobago had nominated representatives to the Tobago House of Assembly.  On 20 October 1889 the British crown implemented a Royal Order in Council constituting Tobago as a ward of Trinidad
column8: thus terminating local government on Tobago and formed a unified colony government.

column1: In 1945 when the county council system was first introduced
column2: Tobago was administered as a single county of Trinidad.

column1: In 1980 provisions were made for the Tobago House of Assembly to be revived as an entity providing local government in Tobago.  Under the revived system
column2: Tobago is made up of 12 local electoral districts with each district electing one Assemblyman to the THA.
